channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report E-2025030141
item.description:
Report E-2025030141

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-07
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 7, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3265 was crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Burke Environmental (BE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents, neutralizers, and hand tools to remediate the trailer. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum. The crew transferred the contents of the tote into one (1) new 325-gallon tote.

item.title: Report E-2025030099
item.description:
Report E-2025030099

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-06
  • City: HELENA
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 6, 2025, at 0821 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Inway personnel in Helena, AR regarding the release of Vydate C-LV. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of approximately 25.0 gallons of Vydate C-LV (UN2991, 6.1 (3), II) from (1) 275-gal poly tote onto the trailer floor and asphalt. The release was reportedly due to the toteâ€™s securement strap gouging the top of the poly tote bladder causing a release in transit, impacting multiple areas of the trailer floor and asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. Contractors transferred the remaining product from the damaged tote to a new tote to continue on to the consignee. The damaged tote was shredded and containerized by the contractors. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DF which were left offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025030100
item.description:
Report E-2025030100

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-29
  • City: MARION
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 24500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 3, 2025, at 0820 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Schneider Bulk Carriers personnel in Marion, Arkansas regarding the release of approximately (2-3) gallons of Crude Sulfate Turpentine (Flammable liquid, n.o.s., UN1993, 3, II) from a portable tanker. Contractors were dispatched to clean the release and perform a transload. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release of 3 gallons of product that impacted asphalt. Contractor cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE, then completed the transfer without incident. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum for disposal.
